prop.head.label.name: Part
prop.head.headtext: Handling Cases Before the Judicial Panel on Multidistrict Litigation

para.paratext: Implementation of the Panel's transfer order is not complicated. As discussed in the preceding section, the Panel Rules provide a process for the “changing of the guard.” Once the transfer order has been filed with the clerk in the transferee court, there is little for the Panel to do.

The Panel does not enter any order concerning the actions to be taken in the transferee court to allow for coordinated or consolidated pretrial proceedings. The transferee court's discretion in these matters is not limited by the Panel in any way. The transferee court may take any action it deems appropriate, subject to review by the court of appeals having jurisdiction over it, to manage the transferred cases. Until remand is sought by a party or suggested by the transferee court, or unless potential tag-along actions are identified, proceedings before the Panel are in abeyance.
Maslon Edelman Borman & Brand, LLP, Minneapolis, Minnesota.
